page.title: 13Trade in Stallingborough
page.content: Most trade is mobile, coming into the village once or twice a week. The butcher calls bringing fresh and cooked meat. The greengrocer brings fresh fruit and vegetables. We have a mobile fish and chip van and a van selling wet fish. Resident trade: There is a joiner, painter and undertaker, a local builder and a horticultural nursery. The Post Office sells just about everything from stamps to safety pins, and our own pub, called the Green Man, serves bar lunches. Supermarkets send a free bus for shoppers going into town.A hairdresser comes into the village most days for ladies and gents. The local Dairyman delivers Milk, eggs, and soft drinks daily (excluding Sundays).
